p: MEO Fl and MEO Lv evoked a robust transient increase in [Ca 2+] i through TRPA1 channels. MEO Lv exhibited a stronger activation profile than its flower counterpart, with 10 Âµg/mL of MEO Lv eliciting significant transient increases in [Ca 2+] i compared to the negligible effect induced by the same concentration of MEO Fl. HC-030031, the specific reversible TRPA1 antagonist, completely blocked the MEO Fl- and MEO Lv-induced transient increases in [Ca 2+] i, suggesting that future mechanistic studies involving TRPA1 modulation by essential oils in light of various diseases are warranted. The effects on TRPA1 channels were quite specific, as MEO Fl and MEO Lv induced negligible [Ca 2+] i changes in cells expressing functional hTRPV1 and hTRPV4 channels.
